title: Around the Districts : Banteer and Kilbrin
body_text:
Around the Districts: Banteer and Kilbrin
Banteer
Banteer bow out of Championship
Banteer suffered a very disappointing defeat to Newmarket on Sunday afternoon September 21st last in Freemount. Banteer playing with the aid of a stiff breeze started brightest pointing inside 30 seconds through Brian Philpott.
Unfortunately Banteer would not score again for another fifteen minutes while Newmarket hit the men in red & white for 1-4 to lead by six points at the opening quarter mark.
The second quarter saw Banteer score four points through Luke Philpott (2), Tadghy Sexton & an Evan O’ Brien effort. Banteer now behind 1-5 to 0-5.
Sadly for the village outfit two quick fire goals increased the margin and made that said margin almost unassailable.
Two Luke Philpott frees narrowed the gap but the Newmarket side still lead on a scoreline of 3-9 to 0-7 at the short whistle.
The gap didn’t improve after the turnover with Newmarket grabbing a plethora of points, although Alan Coughlan did enjoy some change when moved up to the forwards slotting home a classy goal & pointing soon after that also.
As an aside Kevin Roche did come on as a late sub to play his last game for Banteer having been involved playing in the Adult Dressing Room since 2006 while Conor O’ Keeffe also hangs up his boots having made his Adult debut way back in 1998 playing for Banteer through three consecutive decades. Both players giving outstanding service to the Banteer GAA Club.
The Full Time score Newmarket 3-22 to Banteers 1-11.
Team: M Twomey, C O’ Neill, J McAuliffe, E O’ Brien, S Kelleher, R O’ Connor, A Coughlan, R O’ Connell, T Sexton, A Kearney, L Philpott, Conor O’ Keeffe, J Sexton, K Tarrant & B Philpott.
Subs: C Crowley, K Roche, K Barry, A O’ Shea, L O’ Brien, Cian O’ Keeffe, Darren Murphy & D O’ Donoghue.
The GAA Club would also like to thank Eoin O’ Mahony for his time & effort as Coach along with his Selectors Teddy Fitzgerald & Donal Roche for their work throughout the past year as well.
Congratulations
Huge congratulations to Tomás Kiely, Shronebeha who competed for Ireland in the U17 British and Irish Mountain running championships in Wales recently, with Tomás finishing in 18th place overall and was the 3rd Irish man home.
Banteer Tidy Towns
It’s been a busy, busy summer for Banteer Tidys Towns and the good weather made it possible to continue the twice weekly meetings and thanks to all who helped.
The Tidy Towns group is awaiting this year’s report from the National Tidy Towns competition on 24th October.
Rás Tailteann
Rás Tailteann 2026 will include a stage that will finish in Banteer on Thursday 21st May–more details to follow and will need a local organising group to help.
Students hosting HOPE foundation fundraiser
Colasite Treasa students Jerry Murphy, Daniel Vaughan Charlie Daly, Emily Sheehy and Fionn Crowley, all from the Banteer Kanturk/Dromagh area, are hosting a Monster bingo in aid of the Hope Foundation in the Edel Quinn Hall on 28th September at 2.30pm. Jackpot is €1,000 and has to be won on the day.
All proceeds will go to the Hope Foundation, an Irish charity. The Hope Foundation is committed to providing projects of a development nature for the poorest people in Kolkata with a special focus on street children and vulnerable women. The 5 students are travelling to Kolkata in Spring 2026 and will see the work that’s been done there to help the children . They are inviting anyone who is free on 28th September to come and support their Bingo.
Clonmeen school plaque
Correction to last week’s notes: Well done to the group who have now erected a plaque to mark the location of Clonmeen School which closed in 1967 – the funding to complete this project was raised via a coffee morning held earlier in the year.
Community Council AGM
The Banteer Lyre Nadd and Districts Community Council AGM takes place on Mon 13th Oct at 8.30pm at the Glen Theatre –all welcome
Banteer Macra
Banteer Macra presents Jiving lessons and Line dancing with Dancing Derek, on 25th September and on 2nd October also (Thursday evenings) 8pm to 9.30pm each night in Banteer hall. The cost of the course is €40 which will have to be made payable on the first night.
Everyone is welcome to attend the four week course. (Non-Macra members also). Any further information contact our chairperson Joseph Murphy on 087-1369133 or Dancing Derek on 086-1900397
Glen Theatre Banteer
Pat Shortt and Faye Shortt in ‘Shortt Stuff’. Saturday, 4th October, 8pm. Tickets are €30
Frances Curtin Kennedy and Sonny Egan Fri 10th Oct
Glen Theatre Drama Group Drama Festival Mon 20th Oct to Thurs 23rd Oct
Norma Sheehan Sat 25th Oct “Its Wine O Clock”
Sun 16th Nov Gerry Guthrie and his band
Saturday, 29th November, 8pm Claudia Buckley and Friends
Friday, 13th February, 8pm A tribute to the music of John Denver – Marc Roberts
Booking 029 56239
Banteer Bingo
Bingo is played at Banteer Community Centre on Tuesday night at 8.30pm, playing for a jackpot of €4,000. Looking forward to seeing everyone.
Kilbrin
Kilbrin GAA
Duhallow Junior A Hurling & Football Championship Semi Finals: Our hurlers lost out last Saturday in the Duhallow Junior A Hurling Championship semi-final to Dromtarriffe on a scoreline of 3-23 to 2-14. Hard luck to our lads who came up short against a very well-drilled opponent & we wish them the best of luck in the final. Thanks to our players & management team for their hard work & contribution all year.
Football: Our footballers have the chance to make history when they face Kanturk in the Duhallow Junior A Football Championship Semi-Final this Thursday night, September 25th, in Ballydesmond at 8pm. Keep an eye out for our club texts & Social Media channels for further updates.
Please support the lads.
Croke Park Trip Update: Our trip is fast approaching (on October 19th), and we have started looking into arranging transportation. Croke Park have informed us that we have a two-hour slot on the pitch from 12pm–2pm.
To register your interest in going to this trip, please fill in your details on ClubZap or via this link: https://kilbringaa.ie/products/30855/purchases/new
To book a private return bus from Heuston Train Station to Croke Park for €6, book on club zap or via this link:
https://kilbringaa.ie/products/30848/purchases/new
If you would like to book a discounted price stadium tour and/or Rooftop Skyline tour of Croke Park, please follow the link below or through ClubZap.
https://dashboard.clubzap.com/clubs/6920/products
Re-Turn Wheelie Bin: Kilbrin GAA Club recently introduced a return wheelie bin for cans and bottles only as part of a fundraiser to support the club. Despite clear signage, dog waste was placed in the bin. This is unacceptable.
Dog waste contaminates recycling, creates extra work for volunteers, and poses a health risk. We also remind everyone using the walkway to please clean up after your dog – it’s your responsibility.
Over the past year, a huge amount of hard work has gone into upgrading our club facilities. These facilities are here for everyone in the community to enjoy, and they must be respected.
Please remember–The bin is for cans and bottles only. Take your dog waste home and dispose of it properly. Respect the grounds and those who work hard to maintain them. We have CCTV cameras in operation on the grounds and have identified the individual responsible for dumping their dog waste in the wheelie bin.
Let’s all play our part in keeping Kilbrin GAA safe, clean, and welcoming for everyone.
Club Zap: Kilbrin GAA have partnered with ClubZap, a leading club management platform that helps streamline communication, payments, and updates all in one place. With ClubZap, our members can stay up to date with fixtures, results, news, and events while also making membership payments and booking fundraising events seamlessly. This partnership will enhance how we connect with players, coaches, and supporters, making club life easier and more efficient for everyone. Download the ClubZap app from the App Store on iPhone or the Google Play Store on Android, create an account and search for Kilbrin GAA and follow us.
Club Updates: If you would like to be added to our GAA group texts where you will receive updates on all things Kilbrin GAA, please let one of our club members know or contact us on 089 974 0093 or through our social media pages.
Club Lotto: There was no winner of our recent jackpot. The numbers drawn were: 3, 20, 29, 26. Our lucky dip winners were: Mary Lucey, Cameron Cotter, Ciara Colleran Healy, Ciara O’Sullivan & Nora O’Connor. Our next lotto jackpot is €7,100 and takes place on October 1st. You can play our lotto on our club website here: https://kilbringaa.ie/categories/lotto/products
Club Gear: Kilbrin GAA have partnered with Azzurri Sports and have opened a club shop with them. Check out their website for a range of leisure and training gear https://azzurri.ie/Kilbrin-GAA-Cork
We also have a club shop with O’ Neill’s who have a range of various leisurewear and training gear. Check them out here: https://www.oneills.com/shop-by-team/gaa/ireland/kilbrin-gaa.html
Social Media: Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and X (formally Twitter) and help grow our page @KibrinGAAClub. We keep you up to date with match fixtures, results, club projects and local ongoings in the GAA club. You can contact us directly through all of these outlets.
Ploughing match
Kilbrin Ploughing Association will hold their annual ploughing match on Sunday 28th of September. Its being held in the field next to Old Walls Liscarroll. P51D6C7 is the entrance to the field. Starting at 11am.
Congratulations
Huge congratulations to Ava O’Sullivan, 3rd year student in Colaiste Treasa, who has been selected for the U15 BIPPS Cork Squad 2025 (Basketball Ireland Post Primary Schools Inter Regionals). Best of luck Ava!
Congratulations to Mairéad O’Sullivan who played midfield for Banteer U13s in the North Cork Final Friday evening last where they overcame a strong Mitchelstowm side 4-11 to 1-8. Mairéad has also been selected for the North Cork U13 PDP team along with two other girls from Banteer club. We wish them the best of luck in their upcoming divisional games.
Fundraiser
Save the date! Country & Western Fundraiser for Susan O’Sullivan (nee Heelan) at the Kilbrin Social Club! October 4th at 8.00pm. Cowboy attire is encouraged with a prize for the Best Dressed! Entry €10,-
Poker
Friday Nights 5 Card Draw Poker starts every Friday at 9.00pm.
Bingo
Bingo is held every Monday night in the Kilbrin Social Club at 8.30pm sharp. Tea, coffee, sweets and treats and bar refreshments available. A Lovely and comfortable environment to be in for these late Summer evenings. Jackpot is €1,500 in 46 calls. Thank you to all that support week in and week out. It is much appreciated.
Pickleball
Pickleball continues every Thursday from 8pm in the Social Club Hall. We always welcome current and new members to this fun and exciting new sport!
Squash
Did you know Kilbrin sports and social is host to one of North Cork’s last remaining active squash courts. Founded in 1980, this club had upwards of 50 members back in 2009 with huge juvenile interest leading to them competitive games & success.
For further information contact: Brendan Barrett at (087) 2789501 or kilbrinsquashclub@gmail.com or the community page here.
Kilbrin Village Hub
Book your day for study or remote office working at Connectedhubs.ie. We have 2 remote work stations with 500mb fibre broadband, tea/coffee facilities, fridge, free parking. Student rates available. Contact Bas on (087) 1805511 for further details or kilbrincc@gmail.com
Graveyard volunteers
Volunteers always needed for the Kilbrin graveyard for 1 hour, twice in the year. Contact John (087) 2550340
Your news
For any correspondence or information to be put on the Kilbrin notes, please contact Bas (087) 1805511 or Noel (086) 6001873.
